    • Method Detail

      • init

        void init(IPlayer player)
        Don't have to manually call, automatically initialized in the APlayer.setMediaQueue(IMediaQueue)

      • destroy

        void destroy()
        destroy this queue

      • update

        void update(java.util.List<? extends IMediaItem> newQueue)
        update this queue, with external use the same object, not independent maintenance

      • isEmpty

        boolean isEmpty()
        Returns true if this queue contains no IMediaItems.
        Returns:
        true if this queue contains no IMediaItems

      • size

        int size()
        Returns the number of IMediaItems in this queue. If this queue contains more than Integer.MAX_VALUE IMediaItems, returns Integer.MAX_VALUE.
        Returns:
        the number of IMediaItems in this queue

      • indexOf

        int indexOf(IMediaItem item)
        Returns the index of the first occurrence of the specified mediaItem in this queue, or -1 if this queue does not contain the mediaItem.

      • remove

        IMediaItem remove(int index)
        Removes the mediaItem at the specified position in this queue.
        Parameters:
        index - the index of the mediaItem to be removed
        Returns:
        the mediaItem previously at the specified position

      • clear

        void clear()
        Removes all of the IMediaItems from this queue (optional operation). The queue will be empty after this call returns.

      • getMediaItem

        IMediaItem getMediaItem(int index)

        seek queue index by media id
        Parameters:
        mediaId - IMediaItem.getMediaId()
        Returns:

      • skipToNext

        boolean skipToNext()
        Skip to the next media item.

        skipToIndexByIncrement(1)

      • skipToPrevious
